name: Federación Internacional para la Orientación Familiar - International Federation for Family Development
goal: The International Federation for Family Development (IFFD) was founded in Orlando (Florida) as a union of non-denominational, non-profit, independent and private Family Enrichment Centers. Since 1978, IFFD has been working to promote and support different kinds of initiatives which aim to bolster and strengthen the family. Its main activities include delivering training courses for parents, publishing research papers, exchanging information and services, integrating initiatives, promoting teaching activities and research project, content production and organizing events geared towards the promotion, creation and presentation of awards. It has been conferred General Consultative Status with the Economic and Social Council of the United Nations and it is part of the consortium of the European collaborative research project  FamiliesAndSocieties.
interests: Development, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Youth
euInitiatives:
IFFD was part of the FRAMEWORK PROGRAMME- FamiliesAndSocieties (2013-2017).
IFFD promotes global events, expert group meetings and researches on family issues and the impact of public policy on families.
